tool.name: plot taxa summary
tool.description: Make taxaonomy summary charts based on taxonomy assignment
tool.command:
plot_taxa_summary.py #def list_dict_to_string(list_dict): #set $file_list = list_dict[0]['additional_input'].__getattr__('file_name') #for d in list_dict[1:]: #set $file_list = $file_list + ',' + d['additional_input'].__getattr__('file_name') #end for #return $file_list #end def -i $list_dict_to_string($input_files_counts_fname) #if str($labels): -l $labels #end if
#if $num_categories: -n $num_categories #end if -o plot_taxa_summary_output #if str($colorby): -b $colorby #end if
#if str($prefs_path) != 'None': -p $prefs_path #end if
#if str($background_color) != 'None': -k $background_color #end if
#if $dpi: -d $dpi #end if
#if $x_width: -x $x_width #end if
#if $y_height: -y $y_height #end if
#if $bar_width: -w $bar_width #end if
#if str($type_of_file) != 'None': -t $type_of_file #end if
#if str($chart_type) != 'None': -c $chart_type #end if
#if $resize_nth_label: -r $resize_nth_label #end if
#if $include_html_legend: -s #end if
#if $include_html_counts: -m #end if
#if str($label_type) != 'None': -a $label_type #end if ; compress_path.py -i plot_taxa_summary_output -o $dir_path

param.label: -i/--counts_fname: Input comma-separated list of summarized taxa filepaths (i.e results from summarize_taxa.py) [REQUIRED]
param.name: additional_input

param.label: -l/--labels: Comma-separated list of taxonomic levels (e.g. Phylum,Class,Order) [default=None]
param.name: labels

param.label: -n/--num_categories: The maximum number of taxonomies to show in each pie chart. All additional taxonomies are grouped into an "other" category. NOTE: this functionality only applies to the pie charts. [default: 20]
param.name: num_categories

param.label: -b/--colorby: This is the categories to color by in the plots from the metadata mapping file. The categories must match the name of a column header in the mapping file exactly and multiple categories can be list by comma separating them without spaces. [default=None]
param.name: colorby

param.label: -p/--prefs_path: Input user-generated preferences filepath. NOTE: This is a file with a dictionary containing preferences for the analysis. The key taxonomy_coloring is used for the coloring. [default: None]
param.name: prefs_path

param.label: -k/--background_color: This is the background color to use in the plots (black or white) [default: white]
param.name: background_color

param.label: -d/--dpi: This is the resolution of the plot. [default: 80]
param.name: dpi

param.label: -x/--x_width: This is the width of the x-axis to use in the plots. [default: 12]
param.name: x_width

param.label: -y/--y_height: This is the height of the y-axis to use in the plots. [default: 6]
param.name: y_height

param.label: -w/--bar_width: This the width of the bars in the bar graph and should be a number between 0 and 1. NOTE: this only applies to the bar charts. [default: 0.75]
param.name: bar_width

param.label: -t/--type_of_file: This is the type of image to produce (i.e. pdf,svg,png). [default: pdf]
param.name: type_of_file

param.label: -c/--chart_type: This is the type of chart to plot (i.e. pie, bar or area). The user has the ability to plot multiple types, by using a comma-separated list (e.g. area,pie) [default: area,bar]
param.name: chart_type

param.label: -r/--resize_nth_label: Make every nth label larger than the other lables. This is for large area and bar charts where the font on the x-axis is small. This requires an integer value greater than 0. [default: 0]
param.name: resize_nth_label

param.label: -s/--include_html_legend: Include HTML legend. If present, the writing of the legend in the html page is included. [default: False]
param.name: include_html_legend

param.label: -m/--include_html_counts: Include HTML counts. If present, the writing of the counts in the html table is included [default: False]
param.name: include_html_counts

param.label: -a/--label_type: Label type ("numeric" or "categorical"). If the label type is defined as numeric, the x-axis will be scaled accordingly. Otherwise the x-values will treated categorically and be evenly spaced [default: categorical].
param.name: label_type

tool.help:
This script automates the construction of pie, bar and area charts showing the breakdown of taxonomy by given levels. The script creates an html file for each chart type for easy visualization. It uses the taxonomy or category counts from summarize_taxa.py for combined samples by level (-i) and user specified labels for each file passed in (-l). Output will be written to the user specified folder (-o) the, where the default is the current working directory. The user can also specify the number of categories displayed for within a single pie chart, where the rest are grouped together as the 'other category' using the (-n) option, default is 20.
The script generates an output folder, which contains several files. For each pie chart there is a png and a pdf file. The best way to view all of the pie charts is by opening up the file taxonomy_summary_pie_chart.html.
